revised_title: Ascaris Haemoglobin as an Indicator of Oxygen Production in Isolated Chloroplasts
tldr: The authors compared the response of ox muscle haemoglobin and Ascaris haemoglobins to oxygen produced by isolated chloroplasts. They found that Ascaris haemoglobin has a high oxygen affinity, which makes it a suitable indicator for oxygen production in photosynthesis. The study also showed that the rate of oxygenation decreases exponentially with time, suggesting that the oxygen output of the photochemical reaction declines over time.
